citation.article-title: Oceanibaculum indicum gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from deep seawater of the Indian Ocean
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Oceanibaculum indicum sp. nov.
Oceanibaculum indicum (in.di′cum. L. adj. indicum referring to the Indian Ocean, from where the type strain was isolated).
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are 2.3–2.5 μm long and 0.6–1.5 μm wide.
Negative for lipase (Tween 80), amylase, urease, gelatinase, arginine dihydrolase and indole production.
On 216L agar, forms smooth grey colonies with regular edges that are 1–2 mm in diameter after 72 h incubation at 28 °C, non-pigmented and slightly raised in the centre.
Moderately halophilic; grows in the presence of 0–9 % NaCl (optimum, 0.5–7 %).
Grows at 10–42 °C (optimum, 25–37 °C), but no growth is observed after 7 days at 4 or 45 °C.

Sensitive to chloramphenicol (30 μg per disc; Oxoid), ciprofloxacin (5 μg), co-trimoxazole (25 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), neomycin (10 μg), polymyxin B (30 IU) and streptomycin (10 μg), but resistant to ampicillin (10 μg), carbenicillin (100 μg), cefalexin (30 μg), cefazolin (30 μg), cefoperazone (30 μg), cephradin (30 μg), clindamycin (2 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), furazolidone (15 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), lincomycin (2 μg), metronidazole (5 μg), minocycline (30 μg), norfloxacin (10 μg), ofloxacin (5 μg), oxacillin (1 μg), penicillin G (10 μg), piperacillin (100 μg), rifampicin (5 μg), ceftriaxone (30 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), vancomycin (30 μg) and doxycycline (30 μg).

In API ZYM tests, positive for acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, leucine aminopeptidase and valine aminopeptidase, weakly positive for cystine aminopeptidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14) and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphoamidase, but negative for trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.

Among 95 substrates in the Biolog GN2 system, positive for bromosuccinic acid, d-arabitol, d-saccharic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-alanine, l-glutamic acid, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-rhamnose, succinamic acid, Tween 40 and α-ketoglutaric acid.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.8 mol%.
Table 1 shows characteristics that can be used to distinguish the type strain from related species.
The type strain, P24T (=CCTCC AB 208226T=LMG 24626T=MCCC 1A02083T), was isolated from deep seawater of the Indian Ocean.
